Issues.Title: Allow lazy loading modules from within precompiled Angular libraries
Issues.Body:
# Allow lazy loading modules from within precompiled Angular libraries.

[This comment](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/31893#issuecomment-516615243) from @alxhub on a rejected bug report suggests that Angular libraries "shouldn't have any lazy loaded modules at all" but does not give any explanation as to why not.

I'm working on a project where we would like to split our application up into several Angular libraries where each library would essentially represent a top-level, lazily-loaded route.  Within each library we would then like to have further lazy-loaded routes which are defined as children of the routing module within that library.

This is so that our customers can compose applications by including each of the top-level libraries they need, and do not need to define all the child routing for those in their application.

We'd like to be able to use the following pattern within a pre-compiled Angular library:

```
RouterModule.forChild([
 {
  path: 'xxx',
  loadChildren: () => import('...').then(mod => mod.MyLazyLoadedModule)
 }
])
```

Currently, trying to do this gives the following error when attempting to package the library with ng-packagr: `Metadata collected contains an error that will be reported at runtime: Lambda not supported`

We're currently using Angular 8 (because of external dependencies) but if this already possible with Angular 9, then please point to documentation/examples of this; we're going to upgrade to the latest version at some point anyway.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow lazy loading modules from within precompiled Angular libraries" (#36809)

Issues.Body:

- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: #34818

Unsubscribing from a JSONP request will throw console errors such as `Uncaught ReferenceError: ng_jsonp_callback_41 is not defined`. This is happening because the callback function is removed right on unsubscription but this doesn't stop the JSONP script from loading.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-4zmfjr?file=src/app/app.component.ts

## What is the new behavior?

Unsubscribing from JSONP request won't remove callback handler. Handler is then removed by the handler itself:

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/2365bb89d7a37089f596705db19b1ee5d0366b42/packages/common/http/src/jsonp.ts#L107

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(common): canceled JSONP requests won't throw error with missing callback function" (#36807)

Issues.Title: Router should support case-insensitive root index.html
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/router.


### Description
I am aware that Router paths are case-sensitive. While personally I disagree with that, I can work around it with a custom `DefaultUrlSerializer`. What I cannot work around is when a request comes in for /INDEX.HTML. While my custom `DefaultUrlSerializer` will essentially make Router work with case-insensitive URLs by lower-casing everything, it doesn't appear to work for /INDEX.HTML.

I am also aware that the case-sensitivity problem has been brought up before (https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/7691, etc), but I think this is a unique case that is worth looking at.


### Describe the solution you'd like
Since Router already appears to handle /index.html internally somewhere, I think in this one-off case it should handle it in a case-insensitive manner to prevent the `Cannot match any routes` error.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
I do not see an alternative. I welcome any workarounds!

### Sample project / reproduction
I hesitated a bit in considering this a feature request, but in case this is classified as a bug, I put together a repro [here](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-pkxduk).
1. Expand the console on the right and add /index.html to the address bar and refresh. You will not see anything wrong.
2. Try using /INDEX.HTML and you _will_ see an error (in the console), **even though my custom DefaultUrlSerializer lower-cased it** (as seen in the console).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Router should support case-insensitive root index.html" (#36804)

Issues.Title: build: create macro for transpiling javascript file to es5
Issues.Body:
For testing on IE, shims must be served in es5.  Because the shims
served in these tests come from node_modules and are not part of
the angular/angular source code, they must be transpiled to es5 if
they are published as es6. This macro allows for a uniform method
for running this transpilation during the build process.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: create macro for transpiling javascript file to es5" (#36802)

Issues.Title: Parallel build fails: Another process, with id XXXXX, is currently running ngcc
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler-cli/ngcc ### Is this a regression? The previous version in which this bug was not present was: angular 6 (I upgrade from angular 6 to 9 (6->7, 7->8, 8->9) following the steps in the https://update.angular.io/ ### Description I have a shared node_modules/ in a Linux environment. It is used by CI and others users to build their local angular 9 app. After upgrade to angular 9 many builds fail. Re-triggering them work sometimes. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Create a repo and issue many (I don't know, maybe 50) build commands at the same time. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: feat(localize): support Application Resource Bundle (ARB) translation file format
Issues.Body:
The ARB format is a JSON file containing an object where the keys are the
message ids and the values are the translations.

It is extensible because it can also contain metadata about each message.

For example:

```
{
  "@@locale": "...",
  "message-id": "Translated message string",
  "@message-id": {
    "type": "text",
    "description": "Some description text",
    "x-location": { "start": {"line": 23, "column": 145}, "file": "some/file.ts" }
  },
}
```

For more information, see:
https://github.com/google/app-resource-bundle/wiki/ApplicationResourceBundleSpecification
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(localize): support Application Resource Bundle (ARB) translation file format" (#36795)

Issues.Title: Using custom DomSanitizer with Ivy
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/platform-browser when compiling with IVY ### Is this a regression? The issue only appears when the project has IVY enabled. ### Description I‚Äôm using ng-dompurify in an Angular 9 application and I‚Äôve substituted the default Angular DomSanitizer with the NgDompurifyDomSanitizer implementation. ``` @NgModule({ // ... providers: [ { provide: DomSanitizer, useClass: NgDompurifyDomSanitizer, }, ], // ... }) ``` That way when doing things like `
` DomPurify will be used to do the sanitation of that HTML string. This works fine when I‚Äôm not using Ivy but when I use Ivy the rendered HTML is sanitized with something other than the NgDompurifyDomSanitizer. I‚Äôm not sure what sanitizer is being used in that case but I see that style attributes are stripped from the html elements which wouldn't happen if the NgDompurifyDomSanitizer is used. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I‚Äôve put together a stackblitz example showing the issue here: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-domsanitizer-ivy. If you go into the stackblitz settings and un-check the ‚ÄòEnable Ivy‚Äô check box you can see that the text is rendered red, but when it is checked the inline style is stripped and the text is black. ## üî• Exception or Error No exception is generated ## üåç Your Environment Angular Version: 9.1.0 This is also posted on Stack Overflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/61149109/using-custom-domsanitizer-with-ivy
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Using custom DomSanitizer with Ivy" (#36794)

Issues.Title: Generate app-shell as part of the prerender build process
Issues.Body:
Looking over documentation to build for prerender and for app-shell you have to go through the build process two separate times.

Make it possible so that when you execute the build for prerender as part of the same build process generate app-shell as well.

The benefit will be time saved instead of having to build twice.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Generate app-shell as part of the prerender build process" (#36793)

Issues.Title: feat(localize): support merging multiple translation files
Issues.Body:
Previously only one translation file per locale could be loaded.
Now the user can specify multiple files per locale, and the translations
from each of these files will be merged together by message id.

---

Note that the CLI uses the lower level `TranslationParser` classes directly, so will not inherit this new behaviour automatically - cc @clydin.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(localize): support merging multiple translation files" (#36792)

Issues.Title: FormArrays are not marked as dirty when being validated either on pushing/removing items
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/forms ### Is this a regression? I dont' know, haven't done this with older Angular versions. ### Description FormArrays are not marked as dirty when being validated or on pushing/removing items. I think this is a bug. As a user I expect the interface to warn me if I changed something but it is still invalid. I was interacting with it. As a developer I want to warn the user if they interacted with something, but that remained invalid (since they interact with it I assume as a developer that they are aware of its existence and how to add valid input, if they don't know I want to show them what the problem is) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction [Demo of reproduction](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-4pmihk) If I add Items with the add button and don't fill in the inputs the FormArray itself does not become dirty, which should not be the case. Also if I force validation on the form with the validate button it does not become dirty while it should. You can see that as long as I don't touch the input fields the validation of the FormArray happens correctly, we can detect whether it has items or not, but this is should also force marking it as dirty. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: Karma with jsdom+custom shims/polyfills should create the right environment for the tests
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [X] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? No, the previous mayor version (8.x.x) the issue was present as well. ### Description We are using `jsdom` as the target browser for unit testing in our Angular library. Our library uses the `crypto` API which is not implemented in `jsdom`, so we need a shim for this API. We did it as it's indicated in its docs: ```js const dom = new JSDOM(`

Hello

`, { beforeParse(window) { window.document.childNodes.length === 0; window.someCoolAPI = () => { /* ... */ }; } }); ``` Luckely the `karma-json-launcher` offers the posibility to configure the `jsdom` instance throught `karma.conf.js` file: ```js // karma.conf.js const jsdom = require("jsdom"); module.exports = function(config) { config.set({ browsers: ['jsdom'], jsdomLauncher: { jsdom: { beforeParse(window) { window.someCoolAPI = () => { /* ... */ }; } } } }); }; ``` The karma plugin creates the jsdom [instance correctly](https://github.com/badeball/karma-jsdom-launcher/blob/3c364d8988a7a1bc8d4687ec76810cb530adfffe/index.js#L28-L40) with the passed options, and it tries to parse the url where karma is running. But unfortunalety the `someCoolAPI` is not present in test context inside `window` property and test fails with a `ReferenceError: someCoolAPI is not defined` On the other hand, when you try to manually create your own `jsdom` instance (same way `karma-json-launcher does`), with `someCoolAPI` polyfill, and parse any html document which use that API inside it works, jsdom parses the document and the scripst are executed correctly, so that makes me think is not a `jsdom` or `karma-jsdom-launcher` problem. Can be an issue with the CLI, or Karma itself? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. ```sh $ ng new foo $ cd foo $ npm install karma-jsdom-launcher jsdom ``` 2. Configure `angular.json` file as @badeball indicates [here ](https://github.com/badeball/karma-jsdom-launcher#i-am-using-angular-cli-and-the-test-suite-hangs-indefinitely) due to #11561 and #13580 3. Configure `karma.config.js` file as `karma-jsdom-launcher` docs indicates: ```js // karma.config.js ... plugins: [ .... require('karma-jsdom-launcher'), .... ], ... browsers: ['jsdom'], jsdomLauncher: { jsdom: { beforeParse(window) { window.someCoolAPI = () => { /* ... */ }; } } }, ... ``` 4. Create `app.component.ts` that uses that `someCoolAPI` in some way. ``` @Component({...}) export class AppComponent { constructor() { window.someCoolAPI(); //the test will fail here because someCoolAPI is not defined } } ``` 5. ```sh ng test ``` ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: build: update less-loader to version 6.0.0
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [less-loader](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader) | dependencies | major | [`5.0.0` -> `6.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/less-loader/5.0.0/6.0.0) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack-contrib/less-loader</summary>

### [`v6.0.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​600-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribless-loadercomparev500v600-2020-04-24)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0)

##### ‚ö† BREAKING CHANGES

-   minimum supported Node.js version is `10.13`, 
-   minimum support webpack version is `4`
-   `2` version of `less` is not supported anymore
-   using `3` versin of `less` by default, so you don't need to have `less` in your `package.json`, we already supply it
-   move less-specific options to the `lessOptions` option, please look at [README](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader#lessoptions)

##### Features

-   the `paths` options now works with webpack resolver ([3931470](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/commit/393147064672ace986ec84aca21f69f0ab819a9c))
-   allow a function to be used for `lessOptions` ([#​325](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/issues/325)) ([a6be94a](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/commit/a6be94a6da291a27026415d509249e0203e977ad))
-   added the `appendData` option ([#​336](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/issues/336)) ([fb94605](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/commit/fb946051bb4d52a6f9a93fe40a8cd09a56a2c5f1))
-   added the `prependData` option ([#​327](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/issues/327)) ([9df8755](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/commit/9df87554ee1ac57d2c32743049174da20e8a8a61))
-   support `less` and `style` fields in `package.json`
-   support `index.less` file for packages

##### Bug Fixes

-   support import aliases without tilde ([#​335](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/issues/335)) ([24021cd](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/commit/24021cdb9dc0496fcebd6966516ff66584525cf3))
-   do not crash on remotely imports ([#​333](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/issues/333)) ([8e020e9](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/commit/8e020e9cf794d958024cc91ad490b621d5170878))
-   add webpack v5 support ([#​317](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/issues/317)) ([f0b42b4](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/commit/f0b42b4e64dceed0bbb2557c0d88d1c36fe3e553))
-   first resolve an import using less resolver, then using webpack resolver ([#​340](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/issues/340)) ([443bd5a](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/less-loader/commit/443bd5ac0539ca93a998326754bcd607aaecdf1a))
-   fix a resolution for `@import 'package/file.ess';` and `@import './package/file.ess';`

</details>

Issues.Title: ci: remove circle ci cache fallback
Issues.Body:
Cache fallback can be useful in some cases, but in our case it is hindering the CI performance as the cache is growing everyday which results in slower CI times because of the restoring and saving phases.

A fresh cache size is about 450Mb, while currently with fallbacking enabled it has grown to 3.8Gb

Below are some timings taken were we see that having cache fallbacking is doesn't help CI times:

| Caching                   | Cache Size | Restore Cache | Yarn Install | Save Cache | Total Time Elapsed |
|---------------------------|------------|---------------|--------------|------------|--------------------|
| Cache w/ Fallback (Miss)  | 3.81Gb     | 2m 50s        | 30s          | 7m 20s     | 10m 40s            |
| Cache w/ Fallback (Hit)   | 3.81Gb      | 2m 50s        | 20s          | 0          | 3m 10s             |
| Cache wo/ Fallback (Miss) | 0          | 0             | 40s          | 30s        | 1m 10s              |
| Cache wo/ Fallback (Hit)  | 458mb      | 20s           | 20s          | 0          | 40s                |
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR " ci: remove circle ci cache fallback" (#17533)

Issues.Title: rebase relative stylesheet assets when using preprocessors
Issues.Body:
Previously, when using a preprocessor, resources (e.g., `url(./my-image.jpg)`) referenced in a stylesheet that was imported into another stylesheet would retain the exact URL.  This would be problematic as the resource would not be at the relative location within the new combined stylesheet.  With this change the resource URLs will now be adjusted to reference the origin location of the resource.  This allows the resources to be found without any additional changes to the application or build process.
CSS and Less already functioned in this manner. This change brings Sass and Stylus to parity.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "rebase relative stylesheet assets when using preprocessors" (#17537)

# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
PR https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/16988 has changed project generation in a way that prevents external styles and templates from being generated when using the `minimal` flag with `ng new`.


### Describe the solution you'd like
If you prefer this behavior by default, that is fine, but can you please make it so that when `inlineStyle=true` and `inlineTemplate=true` with `minimal=true`, it will actually generate the external files? Right now, those settings are ignored when used with minimal, and I don't believe they should be.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
I just regenerate the app component once the project has spun up (after removing inlineTemplate and inlineStyle from angular.json). That sets everything up the way I want, but it's still an extra step I'd like to avoid.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "inlineStyle and inlineTemplate should have precedence when used with minimal" (#17528)

Issues.Title: expose Angular-CLI VERSION as part of API
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Description Currently, I can can to the following with the Angular API, but not with the Angular-CLI API: ```typescript import { Component, VERSION as ngVersion } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-root', templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.scss'], }) export class AppComponent { angularVersion = ngVersion.full; } ``` And the corresponding HTML: ```html

Angular version: {{ angularVersion }}

```` ### Describe the solution you'd like I would like to be able to do the following in addition to what is shown above: ```typescript import { VERSION as cliVersion } from '@angular/cli'; angularCliVersion = cliVersion.full; ``` and the corresponding HTML: ```html

Angular-CLI version: {{ angularCliVersion }}

```` ### Describe alternatives you've considered Hard-coding the Angular-CLI version number in the component.ts file.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "expose Angular-CLI VERSION as part of API" (#17527)

- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

Create-react-app support   [Custom Environment Variables](https://create-react-app.dev/docs/adding-custom-environment-variables)

We need custom-environment-variables for build. for example:

```ts
Sentry.init({
  dsn: environment.SENTRY_DSN,
  environment: environment.production ? 'production' : 'development',
  release: process.env.ANGULAR_APP_COMMIT_SHA, // git commit sha1
});
```

ANGULAR_APP_COMMIT_SHA changes in every build. We can't write it in `environment.prod.ts`

### Describe the solution you'd like

Support environment variable in build.

Maybe something like process.env.ANGULAR_APP_* or other global variables

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support environment variable in build time" (#17526)

Issues.Title: fix(datepicker): clearing completed range when pressing escape
Issues.Body: The check for when pressing escape should clear a range wasn't quite right which meant that pressing escape would clear a completed range. The intention was to only clear the range if the user has a start, but not an end.

Issues.Title: refactor(google-maps): use assert functions to avoid casting to non-nullable value
Issues.Body: We can take advantage of TypeScript's `asserts` keyword so that we don't have to cast values to be non-nullable, when we've already asserted that they exist.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(google-maps): use assert functions to avoid casting to non-nullable value" (#19178)

Issues.Title: fix(list): selection list marked as touched when tabbing in
Issues.Body:
In #18445 the selection list was changed so that it moves focus to the first item when the list receives focus. The problem is that the logic that marks it as touched was still using the list's `blur` event which means that it'll be marked as touched when focus goes from the list to the item. These changes switch to only using the `blur` event on the item.

Fixes #19171.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(list): selection list marked as touched when tabbing in" (#19177)

Issues.Title: fix(datepicker): end input reset on load when bound through ngModel
Issues.Body: This is something I found while I was writing the live examples. When both the start and end inputs have an initial value bound through `ngModel`, the start resets the end, because the end's value wasn't yet defined at the time the start was assigning its value. These changes fix the issue by treating the entire input as a single unit when it comes to change events.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(datepicker): end input reset on load when bound through ngModel" (#19176)

Issues.Title: fr(table): Add column name to CellHarnessFilters
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Currently, when we want to get a `MatCellHarness` with a column name `key` we would write:

`await loader.getHarness(MatCellHarness.with({selector: '.mat-column-key'}));`

as we have not found any other suitable way. It would be great if we could use the `with` static method and search using a `column` option such as:

`await loader.getHarness(MatCellHarness.with({column: 'key'}));`

#### Use Case

The consumer of the `MatCellHarness` should not be aware of the class prefix `mat-column-` that is added in a column from the library itself.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "fr(table): Add column name to CellHarnessFilters" (#19172)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-button): strong focus indication always visible on fab buttons
Issues.Body: Our generic strong focus indication uses `::before` which is also used by MDC's FAB to draw a transparent border for high contrast mode. Issues.Title: refactor: cleanup fake event dispatch utilities
Issues.Body:
Cleans up the fake event dispatch utiltities:

1. `dispatchMouseEvent` accepts an actual mouse event. This has been
introduced with [this commit](04bf3d1fd54402a5582f6043e2db02fde4598516). If a mouse event has already been created,
then it can be just  dispatched, but doesn't need to go through
`dispatchMouseEvent` which primarily is a shorthand for creating
an event and dispatching it.

2. `dispatchEvent` helper should use a generic so that we don't
need to cast events unnecessarily.

3. `createMouseEvent` should not accept `x` and `y`. This is ambiguous.
It's not clear what coordinates are expected. To improve this,
parameters are now explicit, and a better comment has been added.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor: cleanup fake event dispatch utilities" (#19151)

Issues.Title: build: fix ngcc compatibility jobs not running against packages
Issues.Body:
Ngcc changed how entry points are detected. In the current state,
they store a manifest of discovered packages and entry-points
in the node modules. This means that ngcc won't run for packages
we manually copy into the `node_modules` while a manifest exists.

To fix this for our job, we delete the manifest file. Also it looks
like MDC now has support for path mapping. This means that it will
use the tsconfig from the project root. This causes the release
packages to be resolved to the actual sources. We fix this by
disabling tsconfig parsing. Also it seems like we need to pass
a flag now so that ngcc will fail if compilation of an entry-point
did not complete successfully.

Fixes #19157
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix ngcc compatibility jobs not running against packages" (#19161)
